sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of natural disaster occurring in a region
message_1: A city experiences a flood once every 10 years, and an earthquake once every 15 years. Assuming that these events are independent of each other, what is the probability that the city will experience both a flood and an earthquake in a given year?
message_2:
To find the probability of both events occurring in the same year, we can multiply the probabilities of each event occurring independently.

The probability of a flood occurring in a given year is 1/10, since it happens once every 10 years.

The probability of an earthquake occurring in a given year is 1/15, since it happens once every 15 years.

The probability of both events occurring in the same year is:

(1/10) * (1/15) = 1/150

So, the probability that the city will experience both a flood and an earthquake in a given year is 1/150 or approximately 0.0067 (rounded to four decimal places).
